Row.Text: This is the City Center.
A district in your city for scientific endeavors.
Adjacency: Standard [ICON_Science] Science bonus for each adjacent Mountain. Minor [ICON_Science] Science bonus for adjacent district tiles and adjacent Rainforest tiles.
A district in your city for religious worship.

Adjacency: Major [ICON_Faith] Faith bonus for adjacent natural wonders. Standard [ICON_Faith] Faith bonus for each adjacent Mountain tile. Minor [ICON_Faith] Faith bonus for adjacent district tiles and unimproved Woods tiles.
A district in your city for military facilities.
A district in your city dedicated to keeping your people happy by increasing [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.
A district in your city for cultural sites.
Adjacency: Standard [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for each adjacent wonder. Minor [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for adjacent district tiles.

A district for naval activity in your city. Also removes the [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty for embarking and disembarking to and from this tile. Must be built on Coast or Lake Terrain adjacent to land.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity
Adjacency: Standard [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for each adjacent coastal resource. Minor [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for adjacent district tiles.

A district in your city that provides housing based on the Appeal of the tile:[NEWLINE]Breathtaking: +6 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Charming: +5 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Average: +4 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Uninviting: +3 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]Disgusting: +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing.
A district in your city for industrial activity.
Adjacency: Standard [ICON_Production] Production bonus for each adjacent Mine or Quarry. Minor [ICON_Production] Production bonus for adjacent district tiles.
A district in your city specializing in finance and trade.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity
Adjacency: Major [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for each adjacent Harbor district, or tile edge containing a River. Minor [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for adjacent district tiles.

A district that provides this city with a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Cities that already have existing fresh water will instead get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Must be built adjacent to the City Center.
A district that allows you to build and store aircraft. Cannot be built on Hills.

A district that is required to construct the Science Victory projects. This includes Launch Earth Satellite, Launch Moon Landing, Mars Colony Habitation, Mars Colony Hydroponics, and Mars Colony Reactor. Cannot be built on Hills.
A district unique to Greece for cultural sites. Replaces the Theater Square district.
Adjacency: Standard [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for adjacent City Center. Standard [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for each adjacent wonder and district. Can only be built on Hills.

A district unique to Rome for city growth. Replaces the Aqueduct district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It provides this city with a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Cities that already have existing fresh water will instead get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Must be built adjacent to the City Center. In either case, the Bath provides an additional bonus of +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. Must be built adjacent to the City Center.
A district unique to Germany for industrial activity. Replaces the Industrial Zone district.

Adjacency: Major [ICON_Production] Production bonus if adjacent to a Commercial Hub district. Standard [ICON_Production] Production bonus for each adjacent resource. Minor [ICON_Production] Production bonus for adjacent district tiles.
A district unique to Russia for religious activity. Replaces the Holy Site district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your city border grows by one tile each time a Great Person is expended in this city.

A district unique to Kongo that can only be constructed in Rainforest or Woods. Replaces the Neighborhood district but is available earlier. Provides +5 [ICON_Housing] Housing , +2 [ICON_Food] Food, and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold, regardless of Appeal.

A district unique to Brazil. Replaces the Entertainment Complex district, and provides +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities. Also unlocks the Carnival project, which grants an additional +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity when underway and a variety of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People points once completed.

A district unique to England for naval activity in your city. Replaces the Harbor district. Also removes the [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty for embarking and disembarking to and from this tile. Must be built on Coast or Lake Terrain adjacent to land.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all naval units built in Dockyard[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold when built on a foreign continent[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity
Adjacency: Standard [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for each adjacent coastal resource. Minor [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for adjacent district tiles.
Must be adjacent to an existing district or City Center.
Cannot be adjacent to a City Center.
